name: Swarm of Poisonous Snakes
actions_desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
special_abilities_desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

History
Based on
Snake
Snakes or serpents were reptilian animals that had no legs.
Contents
Significance
Species
Appendix
Further reading
External links
References
Significance
Hordes of snakes were seen as a sign of favor from Gargauth, the Lost Lord of the Pit.[5]
Species
Adder
A venomous snake found in the Duskwood.[6]
Black mamba
A very aggressive snake that could grow to over 14 ft. (4.3 m) in length.[7]
Boomslang
A small and docile snake with a very dangerous bite.[8]
Bushmaster
A powerful form of viper.[9]
Cobra
A venomous snake with an expandable hood near the neck.[10]
Constrictor
Large, powerful snakes that used their bodies to wrap around and crush their prey.[11]
Fer-de-lance
A formidable, aggressive type of pit viper.[12]
Gaboon
A large-fanged viper that blended with its jungle environment.[13]
Glacier snake
An insatiable reptile with brown fur, ripping teeth, and a bone-tipped stinger at the tail.[14]
Jit snake
A large dangerous and venomous snake that dwelled in Cormanthor.[15]
King cobra
A very large cobra that could reach up to 18 ft (5.5 m) in length.[10]
Mushroom snake
A large, non-venomous snake with a mottled skin that blended well with the fungi in the hills surrounding Delzimmer in southeast Faerûn. Its primary diet was insects and it was hunted to make scaletail, a local delicacy.
Nightviper
A venomous snake of the Nelanther Isles. А poison called Nightviper venom was extracted from its fangs.[16]
Tundra Widowmaker
A venomous snake.[17]
Viper
A common type of venomous snake that came in various sizes and colorings.[18]
White-furred snake
A warm-blooded constrictor snake found in cold regions.[19]
